article.headline: Cornell 91, Harvard 79
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Cody Toppert scored 23 points and Ka'Ron Barnes added 22 Friday as Cornell remained unbeaten in the Ivy League with a 91-79 win over Harvard. It's the first time since the 1981-82 season that the Big Red have gone 3-0 to open the Ivy League portion of their schedule. Matt Stehle paced the Harvard attack with 20 points and a career high 16 rebounds. Kevin Rogus, Jason Norman and Michael Beal also scored in double figures. Cornell (8-8, 3-0 Ivy League) trailed by 14 points twice in the first half but went on a 11-2 run in the final 4:14 of the opening stanza and were behind 39-35 at intermission. Toppert contributed 7 points in that stretch. The Big Red came out hot in the second half and capped 17-9 burst with a 3-pointer by Barnes with 15:22 left in the game giving them a 52-48 lead. Harvard (2-14, 1-2 Ivy League) never regained the lead as they gave up 56 second-half points. Cornell was 19 for 32 from the field in the second half and made 31 of their 61 shots, including eight 3-pointers, in the game. The Crimson outrebounded Cornell 29-22 but turned the ball over 15 times good for 20 Cornell points.
